identity.mission: Create a top 1% analytics dashboard that feels like a high-performance tactical command center. Fusion of 'Bloomberg Terminal' precision with 'Cyberpunk' aesthetics.
principles: Fusion over Imitation: Mix financial rigor with gaming HUD aesthetics.
Emotion First: The user should feel powerful and omniscient.
Content is King: Data is the hero; UI recedes.
Zoom In: Focus on the metrics that matter.
Negative Space: Use it to group data logically.
Contrast: High contrast for readability in dark mode.
anti_patterns: Purple/Teal CTAs (Use Electric Blue or Rose instead)
Inter Everywhere (Use Chivo/JetBrains Mono for Headings)
Gradient Overload (Use gradients only for data lines/bars)

buttons.classes: rounded-none font-mono uppercase tracking-wider border border-primary/50 hover:bg-primary/10 transition-all duration-300

cards.classes: bg-card/50 backdrop-blur-md border border-border/50 rounded-sm shadow-none hover:border-primary/30 transition-colors

inputs.classes: bg-black/50 border-b-2 border-border focus:border-primary rounded-none px-4 py-3 font-mono text-lg focus:ring-0

charts.tooltip_style: bg-black/90 border border-border/50 backdrop-blur-xl text-xs font-mono

visual_enhancers.noise: opacity-20 mix-blend-overlay pointer-events-none fixed inset-0 z-50 bg-[url('https://grainy-gradients.vercel.app/noise.svg')]

instructions_to_main_agent: Use the 'Chivo' font for all headings. Import it in index.css.
Set the global background to #050505 in index.css.
Override Shadcn 'rounded-md' to 'rounded-sm' or 'rounded-none' in tailwind.config.js.
Use the 'grid_lines' pattern as a background for the dashboard area.
Ensure all charts use the defined 'chart_colors' palette.
Implement the 'noise' overlay in App.js or index.css.
For the Webhook Input, make it look like a command line interface or a search bar.
universal_guidelines: Do not use gradients for backgrounds, only for accents.
Do not center align text in the dashboard; use left align.
Always add hover states to buttons and rows.
